meanings.definition: To manufacture or construct in advance, especially in standardized sections for easy assembly.
meanings.sent1: The company is prefabricating the walls of the house before bringing them to the construction site.
meanings.sent2: The workers are prefabricating the steel beams for the new bridge off-site.
meanings.sent3: The team joked about prefabricating a spaceship in their backyard for a quick trip to Mars.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was prefabricating her future, piece by piece, with each decision she made.
meanings.sent5: Prefabricating the puzzle pieces made it easier for the children to put together the whole picture.

meanings.definition: To produce or create components or structures off-site for later use in construction projects.
meanings.sent1: The company is prefabricating the windows for the new office building.
meanings.sent2: The construction team is prefabricating the roof trusses to save time on-site.
meanings.sent3: The idea of prefabricating a giant sandwich for the picnic seemed both ridiculous and practical.
meanings.sent4: Prefabricating the dreams of a better tomorrow can sometimes lead to unexpected outcomes.
meanings.sent5: The artist was prefabricating the clay sculptures to showcase at the upcoming exhibition.
